comments.commentBody:
On Oct. 24, 2012, Donald Trump made his “big announcement” on YouTube. Do you remember it?
He started off by saying, “President Obama is the least transparent President in the history of this country. There has never been anything like it,” while fluttering with his hands.
And then he went on to offer President Obama $5 million to the charity of Obama’s choice if Obama revealed his college transcripts and his passport application.    

Looking back at his remarks I am struck by the irony of them. That’s because President Trump, by not releasing his tax returns, has become, by far, the least transparent President in the history of our country.

Maybe the Senate Democrats could strike a deal: Release your tax returns, and we will “advise and consent” your Supreme Court nomination. I would never agree to that, after what the Republican Senators did to Obama and the Constitution. I think the Democrats should boycott the hearings.

Or maybe someone wealthy can take a page out of Trump’s playbook, from his 2012 “big announcement.” That person could offer Trump $5 million to the charity of his choice if he releases his tax returns.

Or, even better, how about us? The loud Resist Trump majority. People could send $1 to a new website: call it OfferToTrump. What the $1 donation translates to is not only a huge number in terms of dollars but a huge number in terms of people.The meaning of which would be, unlike Trump, clearly transparent.
What you say in Cleveland stays in Cleveland.  Even with that rule I am betting Trump gets impeached or resigns.  To the Republicans, Pence has a lot less baggage and is safer ideologically.

Are Session's twinkly little eyes and mischievous little smile supposed to indicate he is a likable little fellow , with the ethics and decorum, so much admired in the Senate? Or do they serve to disguise a dedicated suppressor of civil rights and now a bald faced liar under oath?  His charm is lost on me.
Well, he just took the Federal government out of the suit to prevent Texas from changing voting rights, so, yes, he IS a "dedicated suppressor of civil rights".
The real winner here is Cleveland.  A fascinating place to spend the weekend.
Was she under oath before a Congressional subcommittee seeking to become a cabinet member overseeing exactly such investigations at the time? False equivalence anyone? Or were you attempting humor?

The beast has been awake for a while now. IF you talk about lack of compromise, focus your attention on the Tea Party and their ilk, as well as the other members of the GOP who were turning far right in an effort not to be outflanked by them. They did everything, and then some, to block Obama's agenda. They now tout an infrastructure agenda as if this was some novel idea yet they blocked it when it was an idea put forth by Obama. They blocked Obama's candidate for the supreme court for a year until Trump was elected. They threatened to shut down the government.
The GOP set the example of what a scorched earth policy looks like in politics.
The democrats just need to follow their guidebook.

The very idea of this imbecile being in charge of this program horrifies me. It's one more example of why he has no business being anywhere near the White House.

Heaven help us.
Clearly Putin's efforts to destabilize the US is bearing fruit.
It's amazing how many commenters are content to parrot the loony left fake news fantasies about Trump being this or that, and are oblivious to the realities of the North Korean threat.

am very grateful for your second sentence...

for a very brief moment,
i thought you were solely describing the
Dear Leader of North Korea ...

fundamentally: two peas from the same pod

shudder
shudder

While struggling with a similar disease several years ago, my mother--then about 80--taught her twice-a-week cleaning lady how to cook dishes my stepfather liked. She died in 2012 at age 81, and my step dad (now 96) still lives in their apartment of more than four decades, enjoying the same meals (mostly defrosted from the freezer) he did during the 45 years of their marriage. The apartment itself, which she (a trained interior designer) had decorated, also looks as it did in her lifetime. I visit him several times a year (he lives on the opposite coast), and it's as if she is still around somewhere, just out of sight--looking after him from beyond the grave. Love is amazing.
wow, that is love

You're blaming the Democrats for holding Sessions accountable for the malfeasances of Trump's administration? Pardon me, but Democrats were pointing out Sessions' bigotry long before you were. There is a reason why Coretta Scott King's old letter was brought back into the Congressional record and spoken about at length, to name one thing.
The late Sen. Edward Kennedy was right about Sessions all along.

Sen. Kennedy: “Mr. Sessions is a throwback to a shameful era which I know both black and white Americans thought was in our past. It is inconceivable to me that a person of this attitude is qualified to be a U.s. attorney, let alone a U.S. Federal judge. He is, I believe, a disgrace to the Justice Department and he should withdraw his nomination and resign his position.”

The late Sen Kennedy also tried to arrange a National television interview with the then Russian Ambassador to falsely implicate Reagan during the election. He was caught and it never happened and of course he denied it sort of like Chapaquidic. I wouldn't use his name as his support for the argument.
The good old boy has been very bad.   So sad.
Why are we discussing this. We all know that the Trump campaign was closely allied with the Russians. In another time, these people would be tried for treason. What is wrong with us???
Didn't one of those Russians commit suicide? I heard it was two shots to the back of the head.

Well, you can't trust him.  He lied under oath and he should go.  Moreover, he gets no style points; it wasn't even an artful prevarication.  No crossed-up straw dog of an antecedent, or the modulation of ambiguity that you'd expect from a smart lawyer.

The looting of our country will continue at breakneck & unimpeded pace, if the Dems don't shape up, join the people, abandon the billionaires ... and thereby win bigly in the '18 midterms. Otherwise, it's another crash, we suffer the losses, and the Dems crawl in by default in '20 … the billionaires licking their chops as they sweep up whatever remains. by then, a militarized police & Homeland army will keep us in our place.
What makes you think that Republicans would oppose lynching? I see no evidence of such squeamishness.

" He has these horrible views, but he is sort of not vicious about them". That assertion sent a shiver down my spine, Gail. This is our Attorney General? So he will cut you with a smile on his face? We need to hand the Republicans the shellacking of their lives in 2018. Otherwise, we can say goodbye to this beloved country of ours.
Russia's approval rating by Republicans was 9% just about a year ago. Now it is 34%. Curious, indeed!

Sessions lied. He didn't misspeak. The question was clear. He committed perjury.......period. Jeff Sessions has absolutely none of the attributes necessary to be the U.S. Attorney General even if you don't take his possible involvement in Russiagate into account. He is a very dangerous man in this position.

My father gave his life during the Kassel Mission in Germany to save this country from the very evil that is repeating itself now. This isn't going to end well. I fear for our country, our democracy, the welfare and literally, the lives or our people.
Either a special prosecutor or Moose and Squirrel.
So Cleveland. Republican Convention, right? That's where Trump's people influenced a change to the Party platform regarding Russia and the Ukraine, right?

Overt racism by Republicans is called "playing to the base." Nixon called it his Southern strategy. Nothing new here.
Jeff gets elected in Alabama BECAUSE he was denied a federal judgeship because as a federal prosecutor he tried to prevent blacks from voting in Alabama.
Trump got elected by this same tactic, by appealing to the meanness that pervades the U.S. of A.
It's not complicated. It is the banality of evil.

Obama, the statesman, described Russia as "a regional power."  Franken, the Senate comedian, describes Russia as "maybe the second or third biggest power in the world."  So once again the Democrats need to get on message.  Which is it?  Sounds a lot like situational assessment to me, i.e. which will get the most media coverage...not which is true.  No surprise there, given that it's Democrats.
Jeez, that all you got? Democrats not using exactly the same terminology?
If there was ever a time to call your reps in Washington, this is it. Insist on a full accounting.
Shame? It seems quite evident that Sessions, and just about anyone else associated with Trump, wouldn't know what shame is.
